sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थितिः | दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम् ||1||
transliteration:
śhrī-bhagavān uvācha
abhayaṁ sattva-sanśhuddhir jñāna-yoga-vyavasthitiḥ
dānaṁ damaśh cha yajñaśh cha svādhyāyas tapa ārjavam
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in knowledge and yoga, charity, control of the senses, sacrifice, study of the scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness...

sanskrit: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम् | दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम् ||2||
transliteration:
ahiṁsā satyam akrodhas tyāgaḥ śhāntir apaiśhunam
dayā bhūteṣhv aloluptvaṁ mārdavaṁ hrīr achāpalam
translation: Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, peacefulness, restraint from fault-finding, compassion toward all living beings, absence of greed, gentleness, modesty, and lack of fickleness...

sanskrit: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता | भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत ||3||
transliteration:
tejaḥ kṣhamā dhṛitiḥ śhaucham adroho nāti-mānitā
bhavanti sampadaṁ daivīm abhijātasya bhārata
translation: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, freedom from malice, and absence of pride—these qualities, O Bharata, belong to one born with a divine nature.

sanskrit: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च | अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदामासुरीम् ||4||
transliteration:
dambho darpo ’bhimānaśh cha krodhaḥ pāruṣhyam eva cha
ajñānaṁ chābhijātasya pārtha sampadām āsurīm
translation: Hypocrisy, arrogance, pride, anger, harshness, and ignorance—these qualities, O Partha, belong to one born with a demoniac nature.

sanskrit: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता | मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव ||5||
transliteration:
daivī sampad vimokṣhāya nibandhāyāsurī matā
mā śhuchaḥ sampadaṁ daivīm abhijāto ’si pāṇḍava
translation: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demoniac qualities lead to bondage. Do not grieve, O Pandava, for you are born with divine qualities.

sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च | दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु ||6||
transliteration:
dvau bhūta-sargau loke ’smin daiva āsura eva cha
daivo vistaraśhaḥ prokta āsuraṁ pārtha me śhṛiṇu
translation: There are two types of created beings in this world—the divine and the demoniac. I have described the divine in detail; now hear from Me about the demoniac, O Partha.

sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जना न विदुरासुराः | न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते ||7||
transliteration:
pravṛittiṁ cha nivṛittiṁ cha janā na vidur āsurāḥ
na śhauchaṁ nāpi chāchāro na satyaṁ teṣhu vidyate
translation: Those with demoniac nature do not know what is to be done and what is not to be done. Neither purity, nor good conduct, nor truth is found in them.

sanskrit: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम् | अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम् ||8||
transliteration:
asatyaṁ apratiṣhṭhaṁ te jagad āhur anīśhvaram
aparaspara-sambhūtaṁ kim anyat kāma-haitukam
translation: They say, 'This world is unreal, without a foundation, and without a God in control.' They believe it is produced by sexual desire and has no cause other than lust.

sanskrit: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः | प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः ||9||
transliteration:
etāṁ dṛiṣhṭim avaṣhṭabhya naṣhṭātmāno ’lpa-buddhayaḥ
prabhavanty ugra-karmāṇaḥ kṣhayāya jagato ’hitāḥ
translation: Clinging to such views, these lost souls with small intellects engage in unbeneficial, horrible works meant to destroy the world.

sanskrit: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः | मोहाद्गृहीत्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः ||10||
transliteration:
kāmam āśhritya duṣhpūraṁ dambha-māna-madānvitāḥ
mohād gṛihītvāsad-grāhān pravartante ’śhuchi-vratāḥ
translation: Taking shelter in insatiable lust, filled with hypocrisy, pride, and arrogance, they hold false views due to delusion and act with impure resolve.

sanskrit: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः | कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः ||11||
transliteration:
chintām aparimeyāṁ cha pralayāntām upāśhritāḥ
kāmopabhoga-paramā etāvad iti niśhchitāḥ
translation: They are obsessed with endless anxieties that end only with death. They believe that gratification of desires is the highest goal of life.

sanskrit: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः | ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान् ||12||
transliteration:
āśhā-pāśha-śhatair baddhāḥ kāma-krodha-parāyaṇāḥ
eehante kāma-bhogārtham anyāyenārtha-sañchayān
translation: Bound by hundreds of desires and enslaved by lust and anger, they strive to accumulate wealth by unjust means for sensual enjoyment.

sanskrit: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम् | इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम् ||13||
transliteration:
idam adya mayā labdham imaṁ prāpsye manoratham
idam astīdam api me bhaviṣhyati punar dhanam
translation: They think: 'This I have gained today, and I shall fulfill this desire. I have this wealth, and I will gain more in the future.'

sanskrit: असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि | ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी ||14||
transliteration:
asau mayā hataḥ śhatruḥ haniṣhye chāparān api
eśhvaro ’ham ahaṁ bhogī siddho ’haṁ balavān sukhī
translation: ‘That enemy has been slain by me, and I shall kill others too. I am the lord, the enjoyer, perfect, powerful, and happy.’

sanskrit: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया | यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः ||15||
transliteration:
āḍhyo ’bhijanavān asmi ko ’nyo ’sti sadṛiśho mayā
yakṣhye dāsyāmi modiṣhya ity ajñāna-vimohitāḥ
translation: ‘I am wealthy and high-born. Who else is equal to me? I will sacrifice, give charity, and rejoice.’ Thus, they are deluded by ignorance.

sanskrit: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः | प्रसक्ताः कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ ||16||
transliteration:
aneka-chitta-vibhrāntā moha-jāla-samāvṛitāḥ
prasaktāḥ kāma-bhogeṣhu patanti narake ’śhuchau
translation: Bewildered by many thoughts, entangled in the net of delusion, and addicted to sensual pleasures, they fall into a foul hell.

sanskrit: आत्मसम्भाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः | यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम् ||17||
transliteration:
ātma-sambhāvitāḥ stabdhā dhana-māna-madānvitāḥ
yajante nāma-yajñais te dambhenāvidhi-pūrvakam
translation: Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride and wealth, they perform sacrifices in name only, with hypocrisy and not according to scriptural rules.

sanskrit: अहङ्कारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संश्रिताः | मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः ||18||
transliteration:
ahaṅkāraṁ balaṁ darpaṁ kāmaṁ krodhaṁ cha sanśhritāḥ
mām ātma-para-deheṣhu pradviṣhanto ’bhyasūyakāḥ
translation: Resorting to egoism, power, arrogance, lust, and anger, these malicious people hate Me in their own and others’ bodies.

sanskrit: तानहं द्विषतः क्रूरान्संसारेषु नराधमान् | क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु ||19||
transliteration:
tān ahaṁ dviṣhataḥ krūrān saṁsāreṣhu narādhamān
kṣhipāmy ajasram aśhubhān āsurīṣhv eva yoniṣhu
translation: Those who are envious and cruel, the lowest among men, I repeatedly cast into demoniac wombs in the cycle of birth and death.

sanskrit: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि | मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम् ||20||
transliteration:
āsurīṁ yonim āpannā mūḍhā janmani janmani
mām aprāpyaiva kaunteya tato yānty adhamāṁ gatim
translation: Entering demoniac wombs birth after birth, the deluded fail to reach Me, O Kaunteya, and sink to the lowest state.

sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः | कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत् ||21||
transliteration:
tri-vidhaṁ narakasyedaṁ dvāraṁ nāśhanam ātmanaḥ
kāmaḥ krodhas tathā lobhas tasmād etat trayaṁ tyajet
translation: There are three gates to hell—lust, anger, and greed. These lead to the degradation of the soul. Therefore, one should abandon all three.

sanskrit: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः | आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम् ||22||
transliteration:
etair vimuktaḥ kaunteya tamo-dvārais tribhir naraḥ
ācharaty ātmanaḥ śhreyaḥ tato yāti parāṁ gatim
translation: O Kaunteya, one who is freed from these three gates of darkness—lust, anger, and greed—acts for the welfare of the soul and thus attains the supreme goal.

sanskrit: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः | न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम् ||23||
transliteration:
yaḥ śhāstra-vidhim utsṛijya vartate kāma-kārataḥ
na sa siddhim avāpnoti na sukhaṁ na parāṁ gatim
translation: He who disregards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own desires does not attain perfection, happiness, or the supreme goal.

sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ | ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि ||24||
transliteration:
tasmāch chhāstraṁ pramāṇaṁ te kāryākārya-vyavasthitau
jñātvā śhāstra-vidhānoktaṁ karma kartum ihārhasi
translation: Therefore, let the scriptures be your guide in determining what is to be done and what is not to be done. Knowing the scriptural rules, you should act accordingly.
